intro: Hedysarum caput-galli, commonly known as the "Crown of the Gall," is a flowering plant native to the eastern Mediterranean region. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in dry and sunny habitats. The plant features trifoliate leaves and produces pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its fruit is a legume that contains several seeds, and it is part of the Fabaceae family, known for its nitrogen-fixing abilities. Hedysarum caput-galli is valued for its ornamental beauty and has been cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
